creator: roberto@spadim.com.br
text:
today we have a part of http request on /server-status
for example:
GET /rdm-business/update.spadim?_SPD_USER=rspadim&SPD_SID=jpi9q

but the full request have more text after SPD_SID=....

could we implement a 
/server-status?fullrequest

or anything to get the full request header? or this could take a lot of memory?
thanks, this is very good for debuging what's happening in a development server
(php)

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
Status uses shared memory and we need to limit the length of the request string
as we need to know its length in advance. It is limited to 64 chars. Feel free
to increase this limit in your own (debugging) server. Have a look for
char request[64]; in the struct worker_score in scoreboard.h.

creator: roberto@spadim.com.br
text: could "reparse" header to get information without a lot of memory use?

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
The process serving the status request doesn't have access to the full headers of all the requests being 
served by other processes.
